    6592           9 :     void c_action_common_block_object(Token_t *id, ofp_bool hasShapeSpecList)
    6593             :     {
    6594           9 :         if (SgProject::get_verbose() > DEBUG_RULE_COMMENT_LEVEL)
    6595           0 :         printf(
    6596             :                 "In c_action_common_block_object(): id = %p = %s hasShapeSpecList = %s \n",
    6597             :                 id, id != NULL ? id->text : "NULL",

    6600           9 :         ROSE_ASSERT(id != NULL);
    6601           9 :         SgName variableName = id->text;
    6602             : 
    6603             :         // Look for the symbol associated with the variable given by the name starting
    6604             :         // at the current scope and working backwards through the parent scopes.
    6605           9 :         SgVariableSymbol* variableSymbol =
    6606           9 :         trace_back_through_parent_scopes_lookup_variable_symbol(variableName, getTopOfScopeStack());
    6607             : 
    6608           9 :         SgExpression* constructedReference = NULL;
    6609             : 
    6610           9 :         if (variableSymbol != NULL)
    6611             :         {
    6612           0 :             if (hasShapeSpecList == true)
    6613             :             {
    6614             :              // There must be a scalar variable declaration for this symbol because we found a symbol and
    6615             :              // there is a shape-spec-list (the array specification can't be in two places).  Thus the
    6616             :              // common-block-object acts like a dimension statement and the variable type should be
    6617             :              // converted into an array type (see c_action_dimension_decl) [Rasmussen, 2019.06.19].
    6618             : 
    6619             :              // We need to get the declaration of the variable
    6620           0 :                 SgInitializedName* arrayVariable = variableSymbol->get_declaration();
    6621           0 :                 ROSE_ASSERT(arrayVariable != NULL);
    6622             : 
    6623           0 :                 SgType* arrayVariableBaseType = arrayVariable->get_type();
    6624           0 :                 ROSE_ASSERT(arrayVariableBaseType != NULL);

    7961             :         // This is a part of a variable reference (any likely used many other places as well)
    7962             : 
    7963             :         // DQ (12/29/2010): Notes on how R612 and R613 operate together.
    7964             :         // This rule works with R612 to support references to names that have multiple parts (e.g. struct%field, etc.)
    7965             :         // However, it is difficult to support but R612 and R613, so a lot of work has gone into these functions.
    7966             :         // This function (R613) does not modify state (except for the handling of a statement function where any
    7967             :         // previous symbol of that name is removed in preparation for R612 to build a proper statement function IR node
    7968             :         // (as I recall).  Mostly this function pushes the name onto the astNameStack, but it is a problem that the
    7969             :         // value of hasSelectionSubscriptList is lost and not saved since it is needed to correctly handle the
    7970             :         // interpretation of the names and know which are associated with index expression (SgExprList IR nodes
    7971             :         // already saved onto the stack.  So we add another auxilery stack to save the information about the value
    7972             :         // of the hasSelectionSubscriptList.
    7973             : 
    7974             :         // A possible alternative to saving the value of the hasSelectionSubscriptList might be to do more processing
    7975             :         // in this R613 rule. However, the order of calls to R613 does not permit a stack to be used to save the
    7976             :         // scope to which a named reference can be interpreted.  All names must be evaluated once the full list of
    7977             :         // multiple parts are available (i.e. in R612).  I don't think there is any option here.  so most processing is
    7978             :         // done in R612 and very little can be done in R612.
    7979             : 
    7980             :         // DQ (12/14/2007): Make sure that we have added the implicit program function to the scope (see test2007_17.f90)
    7981             :        
    7982             :         // Pei-Hung (11/15/2019) implicit program should be built at statement, not expression
    7983             :         // build_implicit_program_statement_if_required();
    7984             : 
    7985         231 :         ROSE_ASSERT(id != NULL);
    7986             : 
    7987         231 :         if (SgProject::get_verbose() > DEBUG_RULE_COMMENT_LEVEL)
    7988           0 :         printf(
    7989             :                 "In R613 c_action_part_ref() id = %s on line %d hasSelectionSubscriptList = %s hasImageSelector = %s \n",
    7990             :                 id->text, id->line,
    7991             :                 hasSelectionSubscriptList ? "true" : "false",
    7992             :                 hasImageSelector ? "true" : "false");
    7993             :

    8017             :     /** R619  (see R1220, actual_arg_spec)
    8018             :      * section_subscript/actual_arg_spec
    8019             :      *      :       expr section_subscript_suffix
    8020             :      *      |       T_COLON (expr)? (T_COLON expr)?

    8025             :      *
    8026             :      * R619, section_subscript has been combined with actual_arg_spec (R1220)
    8027             :      * to reduce backtracking.  Only the first alternative is truly ambiguous.
    8028             :      *
    8029             :      * @param hasLowerBound True if lower bound is present in a section-subscript (lower_bound:upper_bound:stride).
    8030             :      * @param hasUpperBound True if upper bound is present in a section-subscript (lower_bound:upper_bound:stride).
    8031             :      * @param hasStride True if stride is present in a section-subscript (lower_bound:upper_bound:stride).
    8032             :      * @param isAmbiguous True if the third alternative is taken
    8033             :      */

    8044             :         // DQ (4/26/2008): The problem here is that this rule can be called in the evaluation of initializers for
    8045             :         // types in structures (fortran types).  This might be an error in the parser, since it allows that there
    8046             :         // is another rule that should be called but it is never called by OFP.  Discussions with Craig have
    8047             :         // concluded that we should handle type initialization using this rule and just get over it :-).

   13931             :      //

   13944           7 :             astExpressionStack.pop_front();

   13948             : 
   13949           7 :         writeStatement->set_io_stmt_list(exprListExp);
   13950           7 :         exprListExp->set_parent(writeStatement);
   13951             : 
   13952             :      // Remove items from the io_control_spec_list that aren't specifically named.
   13953             :      // These are potentially {unit,fmt,nml}.  They are associated with the name
   13954             :      // "defaultString" and order matters.  Which io_control_spec they belong to
   13955             :      // will be sorted out last after processing the named ones (not "defaultString").
   13956             :      // Regarding order:
   13957             :      //   1. If unit is not named it shall be the first item in the list (and shall be present).
   13958             :      //   2. If nml is not named and appears in the list (as a namelist) it shall be the second item after unit.

   14377             :     {

   14384             : 
   14385             : #if 0

   14387             :         outputState("At TOP of R913 c_action_io_control_spec()");
   14388             : #endif
   14389             : 
   14390             :         // This is the case of an option not being specified, as in "read(1)" instead of "read(UNIT=1)"

   20355             : // DQ (11/20/2010): Added Token support using newest version of OFP 0.8.2.
   20356           0 :     void c_action_next_token(Token_t *token)
   20357             :     {
   20358             :         // This parser action is used in a separate mode to read the tokens from
   20359             :         // the file as part of a separate pass over the AST.
   20360             : 
   20361           0 :         ROSE_ASSERT(token != NULL);
   20362             : 
   20363           0 :         string text = token->text;
   20364           0 :         string currentFilename = getCurrentFilename();
   20365           0 :         int line_number = token->line;
   20366           0 :         int column_number = token->col;
   20367             : 
   20368           0 :         Sg_File_Info* starting_fileInfo = new Sg_File_Info(currentFilename,
   20369           0 :                 line_number, column_number);
   20370             : 
   20371             :         // Building the token as unclassified tokens (tokens can be classified by language, language construct, etc.)
   20372           0 :         SgToken* roseToken = new SgToken(starting_fileInfo, text, 0);
   20373             : 
   20374             :         // Currently all SgLocatedNode objects are required to have a valid source code position for the start and end.
   20375             :         // However this might be a bit redundant for the case of SgToken objects.  So we might want to handle this
   20376             :         // differently in the future.
   20377           0 :         Sg_File_Info* ending_fileInfo = new Sg_File_Info(currentFilename,
   20378           0 :                 line_number, column_number + text.length());
   20379           0 :         roseToken->set_endOfConstruct(ending_fileInfo);
   20380             : 
   20381           0 :         if (SgProject::get_verbose() > DEBUG_RULE_COMMENT_LEVEL)
   20382             :         {
   20383           0 :             printf(
   20384             :                     "In c_action_next_token = %s file = %s line = %d column = %d \n",
   20385           0 :                     SageInterface::get_name(roseToken).c_str(),
   20386             :                     currentFilename.c_str(), line_number, column_number);
   20387             :         }
   20388             : 
   20389             :         // Verify that we have a propoer start and end source code position for the token.
   20390           0 :         ROSE_ASSERT(roseToken->get_startOfConstruct() != NULL);
   20391           0 :         ROSE_ASSERT(roseToken->get_endOfConstruct() != NULL);
   20392             : 
   20393             :         // Get the current file.
   20394           0 :         SgSourceFile* currentFile = OpenFortranParser_globalFilePointer;
   20395           0 :         ROSE_ASSERT(currentFile != NULL);
   20396             : 
   20397             :         // Add to the token list kept in the SgSourceFile object.
   20398           0 :         currentFile->get_token_list().push_back(roseToken);
   20399           0 :     }
   20400             :
